page.title: 13A Look At The Houses.
page.content: The houses on the Bromesberrow and Eastnor estates are tenanted or are tied houses and are supervised by agents/housing managers. Other houses are owner occupied, but there are a few council houses. Some houses, barns and stables have been rebuilt or converted for residential use. No new houses have been built,(other than council houses), for a hundred years. The houses vary in age, some are five hundred years old. They are built of wattle and daub, half timbered and/or thatched or of local stone or brick. Most of the houses are connected to a mains water supply, but several homes are still fed by springs or wells. There are a few houses that do not have mains electricity. We found that some generate their own or have a reserve generator for emergencies. Many houses still use septic tanks.
